column1: Medications, injections, and supplements for arthritis
Medicines can help manage your symptoms so that you can continue to lead an active life.
Both NSAIDs and acetaminophen in high doses, or taken for a long time, can cause serious side effects.
Capsaicin (Zostrix) is a skin cream that may help relieve pain.
When the pain seems to go away after these injections, it may be tempting to go back to activities that may have caused your pain.
S-adenosylmethionine (SAMe, pronounced "sammy") is a man-made form of a natural chemical in the body.
